conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the graph of velocity squared versus displacement for two cars, Car A and Car B, moving in the same direction with uniform acceleration.
The graph shows that velocity squared is a function of the displacement \( x \).
The slope of the line representing Car A is steeper than that of Car B.
The steeper slope of the line for Car A indicates that Car A has a greater acceleration compared to Car B.
Since the slope of the line is proportional to the acceleration, the steeper line indicates a greater acceleration for Car A.
Conclude that Car A has the greater acceleration based on the steeper slope of its velocity squared versus displacement graph.
The final answer is Car A.
